title: Comprehensive AI Quiz Platform – Full Frontend Application

requirements.text: Create a Landing Page (/) with: animated gradient hero section with 'AI Quiz Generator' headline, sub-headline, and CTA buttons (Start Quiz, Generate Quiz); features section with AI generation, adaptive difficulty, and analytics cards; 3-step 'How It Works' section with icons; interactive demo quiz preview with a sample question; stats section showing users count, quizzes generated, and accuracy rate; student/teacher testimonials; pricing section (Free/Pro/Enterprise) with feature comparison; and a footer with navigation links. Fully responsive.

quotes: Hero section with animated gradient background

acceptanceCriteria: Animated gradient background is visible in the hero section
CTA buttons navigate to /generate and quiz flow
Demo quiz preview renders a sample question with selectable options
Pricing section shows Free, Pro ($9.99/mo), and Enterprise tiers
Page is fully responsive on mobile and desktop

requirements.text: Create a Login page (/login) with an email/password form, a Google login button (UI only, no real auth), a 'Forgot password' link, and a clean card design. Create a Signup page (/signup) with animated role selection cards (Student / Teacher / Admin) with icons, name/email/password fields, a terms acceptance checkbox, and animated transitions between role selections.

quotes: Login page (/login): email/password form, Google login button

acceptanceCriteria: Login page renders with email, password fields and a submit button
Signup page shows three role selection cards with distinct icons
Selecting a role visually highlights the chosen card
Both pages link to each other and to the landing page

requirements.text: Create a Student Dashboard (/dashboard) with: a welcome header showing user name and XP level; a 'Continue Last Quiz' card; a recent quizzes list with scores; an AI-recommended quizzes section; performance stats (streak, quizzes completed, accuracy, XP points); a leaderboard widget showing the top 5 users; a weekly performance line chart (Recharts); and quick action buttons. Populate with realistic mock data.

quotes: Welcome header with user name and XP level
Performance stats: streak, quizzes completed, accuracy, XP points
Progress chart (line chart showing weekly performance)

acceptanceCriteria: Dashboard renders mock user name, XP level, and streak
Weekly performance line chart is visible and uses Recharts
Leaderboard widget shows at least 5 mock users with XP scores
Quick action buttons are clickable and navigate to relevant routes

requirements.text: Create a Teacher/Admin Dashboard (/teacher-dashboard) with: stat overview cards (total students, quizzes created, avg score, completion rate); a Create Quiz quick action; a manage-quizzes table with edit/delete actions; a student performance overview; a bar chart for topic scores and a line chart for weekly activity (Recharts); a question bank summary panel; and a recent activity feed. Populate with realistic mock data.

quotes: Stats overview: total students, quizzes created, avg score, completion rate
Analytics charts: bar chart for topic scores, line chart for weekly activity

acceptanceCriteria: Four KPI stat cards are visible at the top
Quiz management table shows at least 5 mock quizzes with edit/delete buttons
Bar chart and line chart render using Recharts with mock data
Recent activity feed lists at least 5 mock events

requirements.text: Create an AI Quiz Generator page (/generate) with: a topic input field with suggestion chips; a difficulty selector (Easy/Medium/Hard/Expert) with visual indicators; question type checkboxes (MCQ, True/False, Fill in blanks, Coding questions); a number-of-questions slider (5–50); a language selection dropdown (10+ languages); an advanced options accordion containing a PDF upload button, a 'Generate from text' textarea, and a voice input button; a Generate button with a loading spinner animation; and a preview section that shows generated quiz questions with a gradient card design.
acceptanceCriteria: Topic suggestions appear as clickable chips
Difficulty selector highlights the active choice
Slider moves between 5 and 50 and displays the current value
Advanced options accordion expands and collapses
Clicking Generate shows a loading state then renders mock question cards

requirements.text: Create a Quiz Playing Interface (/quiz/:id) with: a distraction-free layout with a dark mode toggle; prominent question text; a countdown timer with circular SVG progress indicator that turns red when under 10 seconds; answer option cards with hover and selected states; a progress bar showing 'Question X of N'; Previous/Next navigation; a flag question button; a live score display; a power-ups bar (50/50, Skip, Extra Time) in Kahoot style; an adaptive difficulty indicator badge; and smooth CSS animations between questions. Use mock quiz data.

quotes: Countdown timer with circular progress (color changes red when <10s)
Power-ups bar (50/50, Skip, Extra Time) - Kahoot style

acceptanceCriteria: Circular timer counts down and turns red below 10 seconds
Selecting an answer card visually highlights it
Progress bar updates with each question navigation
Power-up buttons are present and clickable (UI only)
Dark mode toggle switches the layout color scheme

requirements.text: Create a Results Page (/results) with: a large animated score number and letter grade; a stats row (correct, incorrect, time taken, accuracy %); topic analysis breakdown with labeled progress bars; an AI feedback section with personalized text insights; a weak areas list with recommendations; a mini performance trend chart; recommended next quizzes cards; Share and Retake buttons; and a confetti animation that triggers for scores above 80%.

quotes: Score display with large animated number and grade
AI feedback section with personalized insights

acceptanceCriteria: Score number animates counting up on page load
Topic analysis shows at least 3 topics with progress bars
AI feedback section renders mock personalized text
Confetti animation fires for mock scores ≥ 80%
Retake button navigates back to /quiz/:id

requirements.text: Create a Quiz Library page (/library) with: a search bar; a filter sidebar (Subject, Difficulty, Popularity, AI Recommended, Recently Added); a quiz cards grid showing title, topic, question count, star rating, play button, and difficulty badge; a featured quizzes carousel at the top; and category tabs. Populate with at least 10 mock quizzes.

quotes: Quiz cards grid: title, topic, question count, rating stars, play button, difficulty badge

acceptanceCriteria: At least 10 quiz cards are visible in the grid
Featured carousel shows at least 3 quizzes and is scrollable
Search bar filters the displayed quiz cards
Category tabs switch the visible quiz set
Difficulty badges are color-coded

requirements.text: Create a Leaderboard page (/leaderboard) with: a global ranking table (rank, avatar, name, XP, quizzes, accuracy); Friends and Weekly Challenge tabs; a top-3 podium display with gold/silver/bronze medals; the current user's own rank highlighted; and a weekly challenge countdown timer. Populate with at least 10 mock users.

quotes: Global ranking table with rank, avatar, name, XP, quizzes, accuracy

acceptanceCriteria: Podium renders ranks 1, 2, 3 visually elevated
Table shows at least 10 mock users
Current user row is visually highlighted
Countdown timer displays decreasing time
Friends and Weekly tabs switch the leaderboard view

requirements.text: Create an Achievements page (/achievements) with: a badges grid with earned (colored) and locked (greyed-out) states and descriptions; a streak tracker with a calendar heatmap visualization; a level progress bar showing XP to next level; and achievement categories (Learning, Streak, Social, Speed) as filter tabs. Populate with a mix of earned and locked mock achievements.

quotes: Badges grid with earned/locked states and descriptions
Level progress bar with XP to next level
Achievement categories: Learning, Streak, Social, Speed

acceptanceCriteria: At least 12 badge cards are shown with earned/locked visual distinction
Calendar heatmap renders cells for the past 12 weeks
XP progress bar shows current level and points to next level
Category tabs filter the displayed badges

requirements.text: Create a Manual Quiz Creator page (/create-quiz) with a multi-step form flow: Step 1 – Quiz details (title, description, subject, difficulty); Step 2 – Add questions (question text, answer options, correct answer selector, question type selector, difficulty per question, drag handles for reordering, question bank search to add existing questions, Import CSV button); Step 3 – Review and Publish. Show a step indicator at the top.

quotes: Multi-step form: Quiz details → Add questions → Review/Publish
Question bank search to add existing questions

acceptanceCriteria: Step indicator shows the current step highlighted
Next/Back buttons navigate between steps
Questions can be added and display in a list
Drag handles are present on each question card
Review step summarizes all entered data before publishing

requirements.text: Create a Question Bank page (/question-bank) with: a searchable, filterable table of questions (topic, difficulty, question type columns); filter controls for topic, difficulty, and question type; edit/delete/tag action buttons per row; bulk operation checkboxes with a bulk-action toolbar; an 'Add to Quiz' button per row; and a difficulty distribution donut/bar chart (Recharts). Populate with at least 20 mock questions.
acceptanceCriteria: Table displays at least 20 mock questions
Search field filters the table rows in real-time
Bulk checkboxes allow selecting multiple rows and a bulk-action toolbar appears
Difficulty distribution chart renders with Recharts

requirements.text: Create an Analytics Dashboard page (/analytics) with: a date range picker; KPI cards (avg score, completion rate, total attempts, improvement rate); a line chart for performance over time; a bar chart for scores by topic/subject; a pie chart for question type distribution (all using Recharts); a student progress table; and an Export to CSV button. Populate with realistic mock data.

quotes: KPI cards: avg score, completion rate, total attempts, improvement rate

acceptanceCriteria: Four KPI cards display mock metric values
Three distinct Recharts charts are visible
Date range picker UI is interactive
Student progress table shows at least 8 mock students
Export CSV button is present (UI only)

requirements.text: Create a Pricing Page (/pricing) with: three tier cards (Free, Pro at $9.99/mo, Enterprise with custom pricing); a full feature comparison table; a monthly/annual billing toggle showing 20% discount for annual; an FAQ accordion section; and CTA buttons on each plan. This page should be accessible without authentication.

quotes: Three tier cards: Free, Pro ($9.99/mo), Enterprise (custom)

acceptanceCriteria: Three pricing cards are shown side-by-side (or stacked on mobile)
Toggling to Annual updates the Pro price to reflect 20% savings
Feature comparison table lists at least 8 features across the three plans
FAQ accordion expands/collapses individual questions

requirements.text: Create a Profile Page (/profile) with: a user avatar with an upload button (UI only); an editable profile form (name, email, bio); a stats summary (quizzes taken, avg score, total XP); a recent activity feed; notification preference toggles; and account settings (change password link, delete account link).
acceptanceCriteria: Profile form fields are editable and show mock default values
Stats summary shows at least 3 mock metrics
Notification preference toggles switch between on/off
Recent activity feed lists at least 5 mock events

requirements.text: Implement application-wide navigation: a persistent dark sidebar for authenticated pages with links to Dashboard, Generate Quiz, Quiz Library, Leaderboard, Achievements, Analytics, and Profile, each with a Lucide icon and label; role-based display (student vs teacher sidebar items); a top navbar with user avatar, notifications bell, and XP display; and a separate landing page header with Login/Signup CTA buttons. Include a hamburger menu for mobile viewports. Configure React Router to connect all 15+ page routes.

quotes: Top navbar with user avatar, notifications bell, XP display
Landing page has separate header with Login/Signup CTAs

acceptanceCriteria: Sidebar is visible on all authenticated pages and collapses to hamburger on mobile
All 15+ routes are registered and navigable without 404 errors
Top navbar shows mock avatar, notification bell, and XP value
Landing page header shows Login and Signup buttons that navigate to /login and /signup

requirements.text: Apply a consistent design system across all pages: primary purple/violet gradient (#7C3AED to #4F46E5) with cyan/teal accents; cards with rounded-xl corners and subtle box shadows; smooth CSS transitions and micro-animations on interactive elements; loading skeleton states for data-heavy sections; and toast notification components for user actions. Ensure all pages are mobile-responsive.

quotes: Cards with subtle shadows and rounded corners (rounded-xl)

acceptanceCriteria: Purple/violet gradient is applied to primary buttons and key UI elements
Cyan/teal accents appear on highlights and badges
Skeleton loaders appear during simulated loading states
Toast notifications display for mock actions (e.g., quiz saved, profile updated)
All pages render without horizontal overflow on a 375px mobile viewport

constraints: All authentication is UI-only with mock data — no real backend auth integration required
AI quiz generation is simulated with mock data — no real AI API calls
All backend Motoko logic must remain in the single main actor in backend/main.mo
Do not edit any files listed in frontend.immutablePaths
Use Recharts for all analytics and chart components
Use Lucide React for all icons throughout the application
nonGoals: Real AI/LLM integration for quiz generation
Real payment processing for the pricing page
CSV export with actual file download logic
Internet Identity or any real authentication
